page.title: 03Swarthmoor Hall,Ulverston
page.content: { Swarthmoor Hall}is situated on the outskirts of the town. It is the old- est house in the area,built in 1586. It is a large manor house built of stone with a slate roof and mullioned windows with an unusual bay including all three storeys. The original contents of the Hall were dispersed when the{Fell family}left;only the carved oak chest of George Fox,his Journal and bed were recovered. It is now furnished in the style of the 17th century,and attracts many visitors. {George Fox,}founder of{Quakerism, first visited the Hall in 1652.He con- verted Margaret Fell whose husband, Judge Fell,protected their meetings at a time when Quakers were persecuted. After 150 years the family bought it back in 1912,and in 1954 it became the property of the Quakers.It is rememb- ered as the birthplace of Quakerism.
